test_questions.question:
Which of the following statements are correct about an enum used inC#.NET?
By default the first enumerator has the value equal to the number of elements present in the list.
The value of each successive enumerator is decreased by 1.
An enumerator contains white space in its name.
A variable cannot be assigned to an enum element.
Values of enum elements cannot be populated from a database.
test_questions.explanation: No answer description available for this question. Let us discuss.

test_questions.opta: Variables cannot be assigned to enum elements.
test_questions.optb: Variables can be assigned to any one of the enum elements.
test_questions.optc: Variables can be assigned only to the first enum element.
test_questions.optd: Values assigned to enum elements must always be successive values.
test_questions.opte: Values assigned to enum elements must always begin with 0.
test_questions.explanation: No answer description available for this question. Let us discuss.

test_questions.optc: An enum variable cannot have a private access modifier.

test_questions.opte: An enum variable cannot have a protected access modifier.

test_questions.question:
Which of the following statements is correct about the C#.NET code snippet given below?
enum color : byte

    green = 1000,
    blue = 1500
}

test_questions.optd: enum must always be of int type.
test_questions.opte: enum elements should be declared as private.
